definitions.definition: a formal written request, typically one signed by many people, appealing to authority with respect to a particular cause.
examples: she was asked to sign a petition against plans to build on the local playing fields

definitions.definition: an appeal or request, especially a solemn or humble one to a deity or a superior.
examples: entreaty, supplication, plea, prayer, appeal, request, invocation, suit; orison petitions to Allah

definitions.definition: an application to a court for a writ, judicial action in a suit, etc.
make or present a formal request to (an authority) with respect to a particular cause.
examples: Americans who moved west petitioned Congress for admission to the Union as states
synonyms: urge; Moreformaladjure; literarybeseech "they petitioned the governor to revoke the decision"

definitions.definition: make a solemn or humble appeal to (a figure of authority).
examples: Russell petitioned her father for her hand in marriage

definitions.definition: make a formal application to (a court) for a writ, judicial action in a suit, etc.
examples: the custodial parent petitioned the court for payment of the arrears
